title: Erratic vehicle behavior when breaks are applied and when accelerating

content.raw:
The vehicle tends to skid and spin when bringing it to a stop when using the break pedal.  Skidding and spinning also happens when applying the gas, but is much more of a problem while breaking.  Gently applying the gas and breaks reduces the problem but doesn't get rid of it.  *Based on the tests that I've performed you could easily apply the breaks in a controlled manor at a resonable distance and crash into obstacles while spinning or skid out of the course at the end.*

Relaxation of the rules in task 1 no longer make this a fatal flaw, but it does add a significant random element beyound the quality of your control algorithms.  

Definition of "gently":  When acceleraterating the gas pedal's value is linearly increased over the course of 2 seconds.  When decelerating the break pedal's value is linearly increased over the course of 2 seconds.  

Image:  The attached image shows the car executing the exact same sequence of commands 10 times.  The steering wheel is at a constant 107 degrees.  Blue lines indicate the orientation of the vehicle.  There should be a constant angle relative to the trajectory.  If they are not, then the vehicle is rotating while skidding.  These tests were performed on road terrain.  Note the outlier in the upper right, that was caused by skidding during acceleration.
